result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis A Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon, he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 4 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. IMPOSED AND STAYED for 30 MONTHS of probation, with the following conditions:

- Court ordered defendant to serve 1 YEAR CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction with release for work, community service and treatment. REPORT on 4/30/2016 by noon. 
- The defendant is to perform 120 hours of community service for a non-profit organization. 
- The defendant is to comply with AODA assessment and treatment as deemed appropriate by the probation agent.
- The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections during the period of probation, bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   


FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
             Notice of Voting Ineligibility

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before Court for Jury Trial.  Parties no longer in a contest posture.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights, addendum to plea questionnaire, and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Defense request for adjourned date for sentencing granted.


  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains in trial posture.  The state's offer will be withdrawn as of 5pm today.  If case is to resolve prior to trial it must be done BEFORE trial date of 3-30-2016.
Filed by the state:  Witness List; Requested Jury Instructions; Motion in Limine; Verdicts
Clerk advised ADA Deann Heard will be handling this matter for the State. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE ROTHSTEIN. Case set for status conference. This matter has been transferred from Branch 35. Defense counsel requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 11/19/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Effective October 31, 2015, per Chief Judge directive 15-19, this case is assigned to the Honorable Stephanie Rothstein, Br 25.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for jury trial today. Parties jointly request adjournment of trial date.  Court grants request.  All parties notified that effective October 31, 2015, per Chief Judge directive 15-19, this case is assigned to the Honorable Stephanie Rothstein, Br 25.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Denis John Stingl for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has not received discovery (statement).  Court orders trial date to remain, defense motion to adourn trial date taken under advisement until next date.  State to turn over discovery forthwith.  Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/26/15 at 9:30am in br. 35.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Court held in chambers meeting with the parties before the case was called on the record.  Parties requested another final pre-trial date before the jury trial scheduled for 10/26/2015 at 9:30am in Branch 35. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9.28.15 and for jury trial on 10.26.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-28-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Ronald Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/11/15.

Defendant Louis A Russell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Louis A Russell in custody.  
Katryna L. Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
